paragraphs.text: Before diving into Sketch, my design tool of choice, I drew out a few potential redesign options. This allowed me to quickly get my ideas down without spending too much time worrying about aesthetics.

paragraphs.text: Hi Greg, thanks for reading! I’m glad you enjoyed it. To answer your question, before conducting my usability tests, I spent some time just perusing the app and taking notes of difficulties I had. For example, since I kept unintentionally searching for flights while trying to book a hotel, I figured other users would have the same problem and decided…

paragraphs.text: Really enjoyed reading this article, Michael! Out of curiosity, how did you determine to focus on 2 specific tasks (finding a hotel & refund policy) prior to the user tests?

paragraphs.name: 22a8

81f21a2f032d.title: Can you explain a little more on the Creating a Persona step?

paragraphs.text: Can you explain a little more on the Creating a Persona step? It didn’t seem to have a bearing on subsequent design decisions. Seems like a fun project and something to bring up in a board meeting, but ultimately a waste of time for the designer to focus on.
Thanks, Peter! Your comments really helped improve the clarity of this article. Looking forward to collaborating with you again in the future!

fd28174bb686.title: Hi Khalil, thanks for reading the article!

paragraphs.text: Hi Khalil, thanks for reading the article! For any design project, I think it’s important to understand who you are designing for. This is where creating a persona becomes useful.
paragraphs.name: 9e3c

paragraphs.text: You’ll notice in my persona that I was designing for a younger audience that was comfortable with technology and familiar with booking travel…
